intro: Ophiorrhiziphyllon hypoleucum, commonly known as the white-leaved ophiorrhiziphyllon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically pale green to white in color. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, often in shades of white or pale yellow. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique leaf coloration and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
